sen.j: 黒壁スクエア（くろかべ）は、滋賀県長浜市旧市街にある、伝統的建造物群を生かした観光スポット。
sen.e: Kurokabe Square (also known as "Kurokabe" [black walls]), located in the old town area of Nagahama City in Shiga Prefecture, is a sightseeing spot where the traditional buildings are preserved effectively.

Kurokabe Square (also known as "Kurokabe" [black walls]), located in the old town area of Nagahama City in Shiga Prefecture, is a sightseeing spot where the traditional buildings are preserved effectively.

Kurokabe Square (also known as "Kurokabe" [black walls]), located in the old town area of Nagahama City in Shiga Prefecture, is a sightseeing spot where the traditional buildings are preserved effectively.

sen.j: 黒漆喰の和風建築である「黒壁１號館」から「30號館」までの総称である。
sen.e: Kurokabe Square is the collective name for the black-plaster-wall Japanese-style buildings from Kurokabe 1st to Kurokabe 3rd.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(Kurokabe Square is the collective name for the Japanese-style buildings with black-plaster-wall finish: From Kurokabe 1st to Kurokabe 3rd.)
sen.e: Kurokabe Square is the collective name for the black-plaster-wall Japanese-style buildings from 'Kurokabe 1st' to 'Kurokabe 3rd.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションを追加
sen.e: Kurokabe Square is the collective name for the black-plaster-wall Japanese-style buildings from 'Kurokabe 1st' to 'Kurokabe 3rd.'

sen.j: 一般に北国街道と大手門通り（美濃谷汲街道）の交差点である「札の辻」（江戸時代に高札が立った場所であることに由来）を中心とする区域として紹介されることが多い。
sen.e: It is generally introduced as the area centering on the intersection of Hokkoku-kaido Road and Otemon Street (Mino-tanigumi-kaido Road) where is known as "Fudanotsuji," whose name originated from the fact that the board called "kousatsu" was erected on the place for the official announcements during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処定訳不明 (「高札」) のため英語を補って訳してあります。
sen.e: It is generally introduced as the area centering on the intersection of Hokkoku-kaido Road and Otemon Street (Mino-tanigumi-kaido Road) where is known as 'Fudanotsuji,' whose name originated from the fact that the board called "kousatsu" was erected on the place for the official announcements during the Edo period.

It is generally introduced as the area centering on the intersection of Hokkoku-kaido Road and Otemon Street (Mino-tanigumi-kaido Road) where is known as 'Fudanotsuji,' whose name originated from the fact that the board called "kousatsu" was erected on the place for the official announcements during the Edo period.

sen.j: 江戸時代から明治時代の和風建造物の連続性が高い情緒ある町並み。
sen.e: The streets, lined with the attached Japanese-style buildings of the Edo and the Meiji periods, preserve the streetscape continuity and the atmosphere of the periods.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処定訳不明 (「和風建造物の連続性」) のため英語を補って訳してあります。
sen.e: The streets, lined with the attached Japanese-style buildings of the Edo and the Meiji periods, preserve the streetscape continuity and the atmosphere of the periods.
The streets, lined with the attached Japanese-style buildings of the Edo and the Meiji periods, preserve the streetscape continuity and the atmosphere of the periods.

sen.j: その町並みと古建築を活用した美術館、ギャラリー、ガラス工房等の文化施設、レストラン、カフェ等。
sen.e: The buildings were recycled to use as restaurants, cafés, and cultural facilities, such as museums, galleries, and art glass studios to maintain the historic streetscape and the old buildings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are restaurants, cafes, and cultural facilities, such as museums, galleries, and art glass studios utilizing the historic streetscape and the old buildings.
There are restaurants, cafes, and cultural facilities, such as museums, galleries, and art glass studios utilizing the historic streetscape and the old buildings.

sen.j: それらが集積するエリアである。
sen.e: This area is packed with such facilities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This area is packed with such facilities.
This area is packed with such facilities.

sen.j: また日本最大のガラス芸術の展示エリアとして知られる。
sen.e: This area is also famous as the place where Japan's largest collection of glassworks are held.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処定訳不明 （「ガラス芸術の展示エリア」） のため英語を補って訳してあります。
sen.e: This area is also famous as the place where Japan's largest collection of glassworks are held.
This area is also famous as the place where Japan's largest collection of glassworks are held.

sen.j: 年間約300万人の観光客が訪れる湖北随一の観光スポットである。
sen.e: Approximately three million people visit this most popular sightseeing spot in Kohoku area annually.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Approximately three million people visit this most popular sightseeing spot in Kohoku area annually.
Approximately three million people visit this most popular sightseeing spot in Kohoku area annually.

sen.j: 旧市街地の中心である「札の辻」に建つ「黒壁銀行」の愛称で親しまれてきた旧第百三十銀行（1899年竣工）。
sen.e: Former Dai Hyakusanju Bank (the completion of construction was 1899), popularly known as "Kurokabe Bank," is at "Fudanotsuji," where is the center of the old town area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Former Dai Hyakusanju Bank (the completion of construction was 1899), popularly known as 'Kurokabe Bank,' is at 'Fudanotsuji,' where is the center of the old town area.
Former Dai Hyakusanju Bank (the completion of construction was 1899), popularly known as 'Kurokabe Bank,' is at 'Fudanotsuji,' where is the center of the old town area.

sen.j: その取り壊しの危機に際し、旧市街の古建築の保存と再生のための博物館都市構想を掲げた第三セクター（長浜市と地元民間企業8社が出資）「黒壁」が1988年に設立された。
sen.e: When the building was facing the threat of demolition, the third sector, "Kurokabe," a joint venture of Nagahama City and eight local private companies, was established in 1988, holding up the museum city concept to preserve and renovate the old buildings in the old town area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the building was facing the threat of demolition, the third sector, 'Kurokabe,' a joint venture of Nagahama City and eight local private companies, was established in 1988, holding up the museum city concept to preserve and renovate the old buildings in the old town area.

When the building was facing the threat of demolition, the third sector, 'Kurokabe,' a joint venture of Nagahama City and eight local private companies, was established in 1988, holding up the museum city concept to preserve and renovate the old buildings in the old town area.

sen.j: 「黒壁」設立の主目的である旧第百三十銀行の保存と再生であった。
sen.e: The primary purpose of establishing the company, "Kurokabe," was to preserve and renovate the former Dai Hyakusanju Bank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The primary purpose of establishing the company, 'Kurokabe,' was to preserve and renovate the former Dai Hyakusanju Bank.
The primary purpose of establishing the company, 'Kurokabe,' was to preserve and renovate the former Dai Hyakusanju Bank.

sen.j: それは同建築が1989年に黒壁一號館「黒壁ガラス館」としてオープンすることにより達成された。
sen.e: The purpose was achieved when the building was opened as Kurokabe 1st, "the Kurokabe Glass Shop," in 1989.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The purpose was achieved when the building was opened as Kurokabe 1st, 'the Kurokabe Glass Shop,' in 1989.
The purpose was achieved when the building was opened as Kurokabe 1st, 'the Kurokabe Glass Shop,' in 1989.

sen.j: さらに「黒壁」はこの一號館の周囲の古建築を、次々と美術館、ガラスショップ、工房、ギャラリー、カフェ、レストランへと再生してその数10館。
sen.e: The company renovated ten old buildings stood around the Kurokabe 1st into museums, glass shops, studios, galleries, cafés, and restaurants one after another.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The company renovated ten old buildings stood around the Kurokabe 1st into museums, glass shops, studios, galleries, cafes, and restaurants one after another.
The company renovated ten old buildings stood around the Kurokabe 1st into museums, glass shops, studios, galleries, cafes, and restaurants one after another.

sen.j: 「黒壁まちづくり」に参画する館を合わせると計30の古建築の再生に携わった。
sen.e: Including the other buildings which joined the "Kurokabe town planning," the company engaged in the renovation of a total of thirty old buildings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Including the other buildings which joined the 'Kurokabe town planning,' the company engaged in the renovation of a total of thirty old buildings.
Including the other buildings which joined the 'Kurokabe town planning,' the company engaged in the renovation of a total of thirty old buildings.

sen.j: 1991年に新快速が長浜駅まで延伸した。
sen.e: The Special Rapid train was extended to Nagahama station in 1991.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Special Rapid train was extended to Nagahama station in 1991.
The Special Rapid train was extended to Nagahama station in 1991.

sen.j: そのこともあって観光客が増え続け、その活況はエリア内の他の古建築の再生・活用へと波及していった。
sen.e: This contributed to an increase in the number of tourists visiting the area and helped to promote the renovation and utilization of the other old buildings remained in the area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This contributed to an increase in the number of tourists visiting the area and helped to promote the renovation and utilization of the other old buildings remained in the area.
This contributed to an increase in the number of tourists visiting the area and helped to promote the renovation and utilization of the other old buildings remained in the area.

sen.j: 400年の伝統に支えられた寂れた商店街と古い住宅街が、今や湖北最大の観光スポットへと変貌を遂げている。
sen.e: The deserted shopping arcades and the old residential streets supported by 400-year tradition are now transformed into the largest sightseeing spot in the Kohoku area.
The deserted shopping arcades and the old residential streets supported by 400-year tradition are now transformed into the largest sightseeing spot in the Kohoku area.
The deserted shopping arcades and the old residential streets supported by 400-year tradition are now transformed into the largest sightseeing spot in the Kohoku area.

sen.j: 町おこしの成功例として有名で、日本各地から視察が絶えない。
sen.e: As the place is famous for the successful example of town revitalization, there are always many visitors from everywhere in Japan.
As the place is famous for the successful example of town revitalization, there are always many visitors from everywhere in Japan.
As the place is famous for the successful example of town revitalization, there are always many visitors from everywhere in Japan.
